website_summaries.verdict: A compact 2-in-1 ideal for students and mobile workers accessing email or web apps.
pros: Market-leading 2-in-1 laptop with 360° hinge for tablet mode
cons: Processor is designed for long battery life instead of for powerful apps or games.

customer_reviews.title: The item received is a used item.
customer_reviews.text: The laptop functions as expected and appears to have come with all of the default accessories. However, it was clearly a used / open item but that was not disclosed in the ad or on the order page. That explains the lower than average price.
customer_reviews.author: codybernie

customer_reviews.title: Great laptop for programmers & students
customer_reviews.text: I bought this laptop for school work. I do a lot programming, and this laptop is great for that. Large screen, decent keyboard, good touch pad, and good performance. For school and work, unless your workload includes a lot of video and photo editing, I would recommend this laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: My worst Amazon experience EVER
customer_reviews.text: From the time I turned this computer on, it had a continuous screen flicker or screen shake (every thirty seconds or so). If you google Lenovo Yoga and screen flicker, there are thousands of results because this was a known problem. I returned the product, and now they are trying to only give me about a 60% refund. When I called the Amazon help line, I am disconnected after five minutes without having spoken to anyone. I have never had an experience like this with Amazon in over twenty years.
customer_reviews.author: Francis T. Corrigan

customer_reviews.title: A Very Nice Laptop For the Price
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I bought this mainly for it’s Thunderbolt capability for my music recording studio. No issues at all except I did have to do some online configuration to get the Thunderbolt applications to work properly. This won’t be an issue for most buyers.
customer_reviews.author: D. Ward

customer_reviews.title: Does not include Microsoft
customer_reviews.text: There's a lot to like about this computer. I've had it for 4 days and am pleased with the touch screen and the general ease of use. I can't figure out how to move my custom photo off the old laptop desktop, but that's my problem. I'm not very techie, and didn't realize that Microsoft Office was not included. Be prepared to spend an extra $99,
customer_reviews.author: babybird

customer_reviews.title: Laptop Freezes all the time
customer_reviews.text: Don't rely solely on the Amazon review. A quick google review will tell you that the laptop is garbage. I bought it just a few months ago and from the second week it started freezing. It freezes repeatedly, with no fix. I can't use the laptop at all since it freezes before I even log in.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.text: The product is an awesome machine. It is fast, great color and has the ability to run multiple operations at the same time. My only issue with my Yoga is that it had no sound card. If that for that, I would no have kept it. I ended up getting the C740 instead

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I recieved the item and it did not work. When turned on it immediately had an error message. I went to the Lenovo site to see what I could do and it asked me to register it, I input the serial only to find out that the item was registered on August 3, 2019. I purchased said item on October 12, 2019. I sent the item back on October 14 and as of today the replacement is still processing. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: CHERYLE VANWERT

customer_reviews.title: one MAJOR flaw
customer_reviews.text: I've had the Lenovo 720 for about 18 month. Works great and not a lot of bloatware. Great machine imo. HOWEVER, these Yoga laptops have one major issue which seems to be consistent with many Lenovo touchscreens. The Touch screen stops working with your finger. It still works with the Lenovo pen but that's about it. Apparently it's a BIOS/Driver issue and Lenovo refuses to address this issue. if you're going to buy this laptop with the intention of using the touch screen, I would recommend looking this issue up. You'll see this issue go back all the way to 2016
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Nieto

customer_reviews.title: Best laptop ever
customer_reviews.text: I've had this computer for four months and love everything about it. The screen and keyboard are full size, but it's very thin and light. I had two Surface Pro's, but they didn't last. This one bests the Surface, ASUS, Toshiba, Hatachi and Sony laptops that I've had.
customer_reviews.author: Reality check

customer_reviews.title: A good buy
customer_reviews.text: Yoga puts its 360-degree hinges to work as perfect. The slot design for the slim stylus is fantastic which makes it hard to lose and always charged up. i5 8th gen is powerful and good enough for an ultrabook. The screen is noticeably dimmer than Hp envy 360 I used for two years. Yoga's battery life (sustained for over 8 hours on web surfing and office work) is real outstanding. The only complain is the touchpad which is not as smooth as my old Hp.
customer_reviews.author: Peter
